fields.name: AffinityGroup
fields.description: Affinity group associated to VM to be restored. Used only for Classic Compute Virtual Machines.

fields.name: CreateNewCloudService
fields.description:
Should a new cloud service be created while restoring the VM. If this is false, VM will be restored to the same
cloud service as it was at the time of backup.

fields.name: DiskEncryptionSetId
fields.description: DiskEncryptionSet's ID - needed if the VM needs to be encrypted at rest during restore with customer managed key.

fields.name: EncryptionDetails
fields.description: Details needed if the VM was encrypted at the time of backup.

fields.name: ExtendedLocation
fields.description:
Target extended location where the VM should be restored,
should be null if restore is to be done in public cloud

fields.name: IdentityBasedRestoreDetails
fields.description: IaaS VM workload specific restore details for restores using managed identity.

fields.name: IdentityInfo
fields.description: Managed Identity information required to access customer storage account.

fields.name: OriginalStorageAccountOption
fields.description: Original Storage Account Option

fields.name: RecoveryPointId
fields.description: ID of the backup copy to be recovered.

fields.name: RecoveryType
fields.description: Type of this recovery.

fields.name: Region
fields.description: Region in which the virtual machine is restored.

fields.name: RestoreDiskLunList
fields.description: List of Disk LUNs for partial restore

fields.name: RestoreWithManagedDisks
fields.description: Flag to denote of an Unmanaged disk VM should be restored with Managed disks.

fields.name: SecuredVMDetails
fields.description: Stores Secured VM Details

fields.name: SourceResourceId
fields.description: Fully qualified ARM ID of the VM which is being recovered.

fields.name: StorageAccountId
fields.description: Fully qualified ARM ID of the storage account to which the VM has to be restored.

fields.name: SubnetId
fields.description:
Subnet ID, is the subnet ID associated with the to be restored VM. For Classic VMs it would be
{VnetID}/Subnet/{SubnetName} and, for the Azure Resource Manager VMs it would be ARM resource ID used to represent
the subnet.

fields.name: TargetDiskNetworkAccessSettings
fields.description: Specifies target network access settings for disks of VM to be restored,

fields.name: TargetDomainNameId
fields.description:
Fully qualified ARM ID of the domain name to be associated to the VM being restored. This applies only to Classic
Virtual Machines.

fields.name: TargetResourceGroupId
fields.description:
This is the ARM Id of the resource group that you want to create for this Virtual machine and other artifacts.
For e.g. /subscriptions/{subId}/resourcegroups/{rg}

fields.name: TargetVirtualMachineId
fields.description:
This is the complete ARM Id of the VM that will be created.
For e.g. /subscriptions/{subId}/resourcegroups/{rg}/provider/Microsoft.Compute/virtualmachines/{vm}

fields.name: VirtualNetworkId
fields.description:
This is the virtual network Id of the vnet that will be attached to the virtual machine.
User will be validated for join action permissions in the linked access.

fields.name: Zones
fields.description: Target zone where the VM and its disks should be restored.
